intro: Trichosanthes corniculata, commonly known as the horned melon, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiky, greenish-yellow fruit that resembles a horn. The plant belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and pumpkins. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with five petals. The fruit is edible when ripe, though its tough rind and seeds must be removed before consumption.
